body_html:
Hey, just note that SWIG might be good for setting up TF sessions from node.js code, but I think that running a session doesn't make sense by SWIG function call, since it will block the node.js event loop from processing events for the entire session run time.

The run call can use async workers:
https://github.com/nodejs/nan/blob/master/doc/asyncworker.md

Or a similar model for offloading the work with threads away from the main event loop:
http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/threading.html

body:
Hey, just note that SWIG might be good for setting up TF sessions from node.js code, but I think that running a session doesn't make sense by SWIG function call, since it will block the node.js event loop from processing events for the entire session run time.

The run call can use async workers:
https://github.com/nodejs/nan/blob/master/doc/asyncworker.md

Or a similar model for offloading the work with threads away from the main event loop:
http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/threading.html
